title: CapEx Operations  Program Manager

description:
-  Experience in other sophisticated capital equipment such as military, aerospace, automotive, large agricultural machinery, etc.
-  Experience in leading capital equipment repair and scrap processes preferable
-  Proficiency using Microsoft Project Or OmniPlan at the enterprise level.
-  Proficiency using Excel, Keynote is must.
-  Ability to resolve conflict and drive compromise.
-  Excellent interpersonal communication skills.
-  Solid understanding of economic metrics such as NPV, return on investment, etc, and their application to program management.
-  Experience managing projects within a defined stage-gate project development process.
-  Additional desired attributes
-  PMP certification desirable. Demonstration of equivalent knowledge is required if not certified.
-  Experience working with contract manufacturers
-  Familiarity with semiconductor capital equipment and their application to semiconductor manufacturing processes.
-  Demonstrated experience in lean design methodologies.
-  Excellent communication, interpersonal and leadership skills. Ability to filter and distill relevant information for the right audience
-  Ability to deal with rapid development cycles & remains flexible and calm in the face of ambiguity
-  Detailed knowledge of product development processes as well as a strong understanding of manufacturing processes
key_qualifications:
This position is based in China for leading on-site Capital Equipment program management functions for iPhone Operations team at contract manufacturing sites. Working cross- functionally in a team environment, the successful candidate will lead execution of program plans for both new and sustaining programs which result in successful completion of projects.
The program manager will also act as on-site leader for resolving all blocking issues from contract manufacturers and would drive closure and consensus among project team members, and call out issues as vital in timely manner when the project team is off track.
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
-  Lead multi-functional communication between internal Apple team and contract manufacturer organization
-  Facilitate good communication and collaboration across engineering functions, operations, and vendors
-  Create and maintain project schedules. Provide timely issue resolution and critical path activities
-  Offer multiple levels of status updates across a wide spectrum of individual projects to executive management.
-  Drive CM teams for capital equipment transfers across sites, to maintain high traceability and usability of Apple’s assets, and to implement efficiency in equipment repair process to minimize downtime, spares and repair TAT
education_experience: -  A Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience in a technical field with at least 5 years of program management experience that involves tactical coordination (scope, schedule & resource management) of multiple concurrent projects.
